oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High temperature oxidation behaviour of Fe-Al-C alloys: an overview
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAO, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: iron-aluminum-alloys
intermetallic alloys
sulfuric-acid
carbon
corrosion
resistance
iron aluminides
carbides
oxidation
sulfidation
hot corrosion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Carbide containing dual phase iron aluminide offers two-fold benefits; it posses high temperature strength and high resistance to probability of hydrogen embrittlement compared to single-phase iron aluminide. In this paper, we summarise the recent developments related to the oxidation behaviour of Fe-Al-C alloys. Emphasis is placed on the each variables of the system C, Al and temperature, and tried to differentiate the oxidation behaviour between Fe(3)A1/alpha and Fe3AlC phases while reviewing the oxidation resistance of Fe-Al-C alloys. (C) 2003
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING, 364(1-2), 232-239
